correction_response:
This tweet is partially correct. The UK does not have a codified constitution, which allows for referendums on constitutional reforms without a binding rule. However, while the UK was a member of the EU, it was effectively under a codified constitution - the constitution of the EU. This constrained both the government and Parliament. The question of whether the UK should adopt a codified constitution is a topic of ongoing debate.

https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/34876878/
